DataElementConcept.preferredName: Invasive Breast Carcinoma Neoplasm by Morphology Missing Value Reason Name
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women. --2003:definition pending_A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available.  A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept.  In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Invasive Breast Carcinoma Neoplasm by Morphology
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women. --2003:definition pending

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma that infiltrates the breast parenchyma.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas arising from the terminal ductal lobular unit (TDLU).  Often, the invasive adenocarcinoma co-exists with ductal or lobular carcinoma in situ.  It is the most common carcinoma affecting women.
A classification system grouping neoplasms according to their cellular characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available. A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept. In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
